Description: Fragment of round handle at neck join from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine micaceous pink-brown; cream surface. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Name Philemo(n). cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 177. P. Palazzo, Le anfore di Apani (Brindisi), Rome 2013, 143-4. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 71, 2.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1293)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, G30, Hieroglyphs: Ancient Egpyt Unlocked
